intro: Pilea quichensis, commonly known as the Mexican begonia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Begoniaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage is often variegated, featuring shades of green, white, and pink, which adds to its ornamental value. Pilea quichensis prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
